headline: CBI arrests promoters of Diamond Power Infrastructure in Rs 2,654-cr bank fraud
description: The agency in an FIR said that the DPIL, which manufactures electric cables and equipment, is promoted by Suresh Narain Bhatnagar and his sons Amit and Sumit, who are also the directors of the firm.
articleBody: The CBI arrested today the promoters and directors of Vadodara-based Diamond Power Infrastructure Ltd. (DPIL) in connection with an alleged over Rs 2,654 crore bank loan fraud case, officials said here.  The agency in an FIR said that the DPIL, which manufactures electric cables and equipment, is promoted by Suresh Narain Bhatnagar and his sons Amit and Sumit, who are also the directors of the firm.  The loan, it said, was declared a non-performing asset in 2016-17.  &quot;It is alleged that the DPIL, through its management, (had) fraudulently availed credit facilities from a consortium of 11 banks (both public and private) since 2008, leaving behind an outstanding debit of Rs 2,654.40 crore as of June 29, 2016,&quot; the agency said.  A non-bailable warrant was issued against them on the agency's request, CBI spokesperson Abhishek Dayal said.  The agency had received input about the whereabouts of the Bhatnagar trio late last night following which teams were sent to arrest them.  &quot;The accused were arrested today and will be produced before the Special Judge, Ahmedabad,&quot; Dayal said.  The company and its directors managed to get term loans and credit facilities despite being on the Reserve Bank of India's defaulters list and the Export Credit Guarantee Corporation's caution list at the time of the initial sanction of credit limits by the consortium, the CBI alleged.  When the consortium was formed in 2008, the Axis Bank was the lead bank for the term loan and the Bank of India was the lead bank for cash credit limits.  It is alleged that the firm, with active connivance of officials from various banks, managed to get enhanced credit facilities.  According to the CBI, the company had allegedly submitted false stock statements to the lead bank by treating receivables more than 180 days (non-current asset) as less than 180 days (current asset) to get more drawing power in their cash credit accounts.  Earlier in the day, the Gujarat Anti Terrorist Squad said the trio were held from a hotel in Udaipur last night.

headline: Diamond Power gets shareholder nod to convert debt into equity
description: The special resolution to convert the debt of Rs 855 crore and Rs 1,543 crore into equity shares and OCRPS under strategic debt restructuring (SDR) was passed by requisite majority by the shareholders, the company stated in a BSE filing.
articleBody: Diamond Power Infrastructure said its shareholders have approved the proposal to convert Rs 2,398 crore debt into equity and optionally convertible redeemable preference shares (OCRPS). The special resolution to convert the debt of Rs 855 crore and Rs 1,543 crore into equity shares and OCRPS under strategic debt restructuring (SDR) was passed by requisite majority by the shareholders, the company stated in a BSE filing. According to the statement, Bank of India will be alloted 5.43 crore shares convert debt of Rs 224.34 crore followed by Bank of Baroda at 2.71 crore shares for Rs 111.9 crore and ICICI Bank at 2.22 crore shares for Rs 91.72 crore loans under the SDR. Under this arrangement company will allot leders 20.70 crore shares to convert a total debt of Rs 854.82 crore. Similarly, the lenders will be alloted 5.28 crore OCRPS to convert loans of Rs 1,543 crore of the lenders. Bank of India will be issued 1.38 crore OCRPS to convert debt of Rs 405 crore. Bank of Baroda will be issued 69.17 lakh OCRPS to convert loan amount of Rs 202 crore while it is proposed to allot 56.70 lakh OCRPS to ICICI Bank for its loan of Rs 122 crore to the company.

headline: Diamond Power Infrastructure Q3 loss widens to Rs 213 cr
description: Diamond Power Infrastructure today reported consolidated net loss of Rs 213.23 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2016.
articleBody: Diamond Power Infrastructure today reported consolidated net loss of Rs 213.23 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2016. The company had reported a consolidated net loss of the Rs 53.01 crore in the corresponding period of 2015, it said in a BSE filing today. According to the statement, the company's income from operations declined to Rs 252.08 crore in the third quarter compared to Rs 502.70 crore. In a seperate filing, it also informed the BSE that its board, at a meeting held today, has approved issuance of 8.09 crore warrants convertible into shares of the company to various strategic investors on preferential basis/Funds/FIIs. Yesterday, the company had said that its board will consider proposal for the issue of around 5.31 crore warrants amounting to Rs 244.55 crore to CKP Power Finserve Pvt Ltd on preferential basis.

headline: Dimond Power Infra to convert Rs 855 cr debt into equity
description: As per the pricing formula under strategic debt restructuring (SDR) guidelines of RBI, the price per share will be Rs 41.28 per scrip, considering the cut-off date as on June 29, 2016, a BSE filing said.
articleBody: Diamond Power Infra today said a joint lenders forum (JLF) decided to convert debt of around Rs 855 crore into equity at a meeting held yesterday. As per the pricing formula under strategic debt restructuring (SDR) guidelines of RBI, the price per share will be Rs 41.28 per scrip, considering the cut-off date as on June 29, 2016, a BSE filing said. According to the statement, this step will bring down the company's debt by Rs 855 crore, correcting the capital structure of the company in a major way and reducing burden substantially. The company's committee of board of directors will meet on January 24 for allotment of shares to the various lenders in their agreed proportion. The company had approached the lenders in March 2016 for a comprehensive restructuring plan that envisaged conversion of debt into equity and induction of a new investor. The company has presence with solutions spanning across 90 percent of power transmission and distribution value chain. The stock was trading at Rs 37.25, up 4.93 percent, on BSE in the afternoon.

headline: Jiangsu Longzhe may buy majority stake in Diamond Power
description: EY was mandated by the company's lenders to evaluate alternative options and finalise the best option in June 2016 and this exercise leads to conclusion of a fair and transparent process of investor induction followed by the lenders in the company, Diamond Power said in a BSE filing.
articleBody: Chinese firm Jiangsu Longzhe may soon seal a deal to buy majority stake in Diamond Power Infrastructure for USD 125 million. EY was mandated by the company's lenders to evaluate alternative options and finalise the best option in June 2016 and this exercise leads to conclusion of a fair and transparent process of investor induction followed by the lenders in the company, Diamond Power said in a BSE filing. &quot;The modalities and terms sheet of Jiangsu Longzhe was discussed in details to finalise the next steps of the transactions,&quot; it said. Earlier this month, the company had informed BSE about receiving an investment proposal of around USD 125 million (Rs 840 crore) from Jiangsu Longzhe Trade &amp;amp; Development Company and their associates. The joint lenders forum had decided re-alignment of debt (SDR) as per the plan submitted by the company on the recommendation of lenders core committee. &quot;The offer received from Jiangsu Longzhe Trade &amp;amp; Development Company, Nanjig, PR China is considered at the Base Minimum while carrying out the above process by Lenders through EY, any better then it will be considered. The company estimates to complete the entire process in 90-100 days,&quot; Diamond Power had said last month.
